Class FlowerManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.AbstractCollection<E>

        • java.util.TreeSet<Flower>
          • business.FlowerManager
  • All Implemented Interfaces:

    public class FlowerManager
extends java.util.TreeSet<Flower>

    • Constructor Detail

      • FlowerManager

        public FlowerManager()

    • Method Detail

      • add

        public void add()
        Adds a new flower to the FlowerManager. Prompts the user to enter details such as flower ID, description, import date, unit price, and category. Validates the input and ensures the flower ID is unique.

      • find

        public Flower find(java.lang.String id)
        Finds a flower in the FlowerManager by the specified ID.
        Parameters:
        id - The ID of the flower to find.
        Returns:
        The found flower object, or null if no flower with the specified ID is found.

      • find

        public void find()
        Prompts the user to choose whether to find a flower by name or ID and calls the respective find method. If the user enters an invalid choice, they are prompted again until a valid choice is entered.

      • findById

        public void findById()
        Prompts the user to enter a flower ID and finds the flower with the specified ID. If the flower is found, its information is displayed. If the flower is not found, a message indicating that the flower does not exist is printed.

      • findByName

        public void findByName()
        Prompts the user to enter a flower name and finds all flowers with the specified name. If flowers with the specified name are found, their information is displayed. If no flowers with the specified name are found, a message indicating that the flowers do not exist is printed.

      • display

        public void display()
        Displays the information of all flowers in the FlowerManager. The information of each flower is displayed using the showInfo() method.

      • update

        public void update()
        Updates the information of a flower in the FlowerManager. Prompts the user to enter the flower ID and finds the corresponding flower. If the flower is found, prompts the user to enter optional updated information such as description, import date, price, and category. Validates the input and updates the flower information accordingly. Prints a success message if the update is successful.

      • delete

        public void delete(OrderManager om)
        Deletes a flower from the FlowerManager. Prompts the user to enter the flower ID and finds the corresponding flower. Checks if the flower is associated with any orders in the given OrderManager. If the flower is found and not present in any orders, deletes the flower from the FlowerManager. Prints a success message if the deletion is successful. Prints an error message if the flower is found in an order and cannot be deleted.
        Parameters:
        om - The OrderManager to check if the flower is present in any orders.

      • toStringArrayList

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> toStringArrayList()
        Converts the list of flowers to an ArrayList of strings.
        Returns:
        The ArrayList of strings representing the flowers.
